column4: does anyone know how to find ip address using ubuntu's network tools?
or how to work netstat in ubuntu?
ip address of what?
if you want that you can get netstat -a
then start a p2p file transfer and run it again and compare
thanks :) I did the same in windows, but just couldn't figure it out in ubuntu, I'm new to linux
same command
yeah, totally slipped out of my mind that terminal is the command substitute
i use yakuake in kde
I read somewhere that it should be easier and probably even GUI based if we use the Ubuntu Network Tools?
gui is slow man
true, but is that possible?
I do see a netstat tab in the network tools, cannot figure out how that works though ... and are there any particular advantages of using Yakuake over the default terminal?
i dunno, i se cli so much now
its a cli command
does Gnome have some terminal emulators of it's own?
or do I install Yakuake with all those KDE packages
you'll need kde apps for yakuake
gnome uses terminal
aren't there more?
theres thousands
do you know any good one?
